channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: In correct positions of street signage to enforce a no right turn, 8th October
item.description:
The street sign for a no right turn is in the wrong position on Shaftesbury avenue travelling northbound To enforce a no right turn into mercer street Vehicles travelling northbound are not going to see the no right sign Which is on the opposite side of the road No doubt the council is enjoying making this junction a cash cow as motorists unless aware are not going to see it This in itself is an illegal enforcement as the signs are not in the Correct position Ideally they need to be in the crossing or on the junction on the east side Warming cars not to turn right I would be interested to hear your views about this issue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Long Acre, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Needles and syringes in the road, 8th October
item.description:
A neighbour reported a number of needles (sharps) and syringes in the road - highly dangerous - especially for animals and children.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Digby Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big rubbish bags dumped on the side of the pavement, 8th October
item.description:
These look like trade materials bags, they are full of rubbish. This is a prime location for recurring fly tipping. Along the entire estate. Some surveillance cameras and better police enforcement would help tackling the concerning trend of fly tipping. Unfortunately It’s becoming a regular issue across Plumstead

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walmer Terrace, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All kinds of garbage in front of the entrance to the property, 8th October
item.description:
Whenever someone wants to throw away any kind of trash—irons, bed frames, chairs, towels, hair dryers, etc.—they leave it at the entrance, and it's very unpleasant because they bring and throw away more and more things, even garbage bags. This happens all the time. Then the foxes tear up those bags or whatever they leave behind, and it spills all over the entrance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Bellenden Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two white chairs dumped outside 2 Archie Street, 8th October
item.description:
Two of the white chairs advertised by Knight Frank (“ 2 bedroom penthouse for sale in Archie Street, London, SE1”, Property Ref: cnw012553211) were dumped in the bin room then the street outside the building. Residents already reported this to Knight Frank, who say they asked the flat to remove them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Archie Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tennis courts security fence West Heath Recreation Ground, 8th October
item.description:
Someone has attempted to pull open one section of the metal fence on the left hand side of the courts. This is on the strip of land between the Lawn bowls club and the tennis courts . This will allow anyone free access to the courts and to be able to open the gate to the courts. This may result in further vandalism to the tennis courts surface from bikes being ridden on them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clovelly Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights not working - sutherland ave / harrow road, 8th October
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights at this uk power networks roadworks site (junction of Harrow Road and sutherland ave) have stopped working. Traffic is trying to negotiate narrow roadworks and it is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 354, Harrow Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet
